bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Order to Show Cause.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF FLETCHER DECKER FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND WRIT OF CERTI- ORARI.))))

This matter coming on for hearing upon the petition of Fletcher Decker, by and through his attorneys, Beeler & Sullivan, praying for a writ of habeas corpus and a writ of certiorari, and it appearing to the court from said petition, duly on file herein, that said Fletcher Decker is imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by John M. Boyle, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at the County Jail of King County, in the city of Seattle, in said State, the same being within the jurisdiction of this court, which imprisonment and restraint is under and by virtue of a pretended commitment issued by Robert W. McClelland, Commissioner of the United States, in and for said Western District of Washington, Northern Division, in a proceeding then pending before said Commissioner entitled, "In the Matter of the extradition of Fletcher Decker", and in which it is alleged in said Petition the said Commissioner was without lawful authority or jurisdiction, and said petitioner, by his said attorneys, having moved the court for an order directed to said Marshal commanding him to show cause, if any he has, why a writ of habeas corpus and a writ of certiorari should not be issued herein, and the court being fully advised as to the contents of said petition, and it appearing that said motion should be granted;

NOW, THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED and ADJUDGED, that John M. Boyle, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, be and he is hereby commanded to show cause, if any he has, before the above named Court on Friday, the 9th day of September, A.D. 1921, at ten o'clock a.m., or as soon
thereafter as counsel can be heard, why a writ of habeas corpus and a writ of certiorari should not be issued by this court, as prayed for in said petiton.
Done in open court this 6th day of September, 1921.
Jeremiah Neterer J U D G E.
